result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross T. Brandau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ross T. Brandau is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ross T. Brandau was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ross T. Brandau was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply money on file and balance to be paid within 60 days.

Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to sign up for Probation in Hudson WI, but it may be transferred to LaCrosse WI where Defendant resides.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

DE called to request the payoff bal.  DE was given a bal of $536 & advised to pay it by 4:30 pm today as his pymt was due on the 1st.  jaf
**DE called back to verify that his pymt was rec'd.  DE was advised that his $536 pymt was rec'd, but hasn't been receipted yet.  jaf

DE called this afternoon to confirm that his GPNet pymt was rec'd & gave a confirmation #, stating that he was told by Judge Lundell & the Diversion Program Coordinator that he had to do so.  DE was advised that he doesn't necessarily have to povide a confirmation # ea mo, but he may call to confirm receipt of his pymt.  DE became argumentative & stated he didn't want another FTP warrant & that he was ordered to do so.  I did confirm that the DE's pymt was rec'd, but just arrived via fax & has not been receipted yet.  jaf

Order for payment on March 5, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
DE mailed copy on this date. jaf
from DE requesting a Pymt Plan of $25/mo comm 3-01-18.  jaf
From DE in writing.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 3-01-18.  $15 PPF added.  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt.  jaf

From DE re: NSF pymt & ext.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him he was already given a courtesy ext without having to file a written request & if a Pymt Plan is needed, he must submit that request by 4:30 pm tomrw or the WA will be issued immediately.  DE stated that he is ill, forgot his pymt, then had to pay other bills.  jaf

Attempted to give DEF a courtesy call to inform he is about to be warranted for nonpayment of his fine due to his payment being NSF, as discussed in our 2-6-18 phone conversation.  No answer by DEF and mailbox is not set up.  cah
NSF epayment pd by DEF, $686.00 on 2-2-18.  Receipt #18R 001711 voided 2-6-18.  Defendant approved to make a new payment by 2-14-18 including $25 NSF fee has been added.  No letter will be sent. cah

call fr DEF stating he got an email saying his payment he made on 2-2-18 has been returned.  After checking the US Bank website, I confirmed his payment has been returned because the account was closed.  DEF was approved to make another payment no later than 2-14-18. cah
Final notice sent, due 2-1-18. cah

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz   DF:  Ross T. Brandau appeared. Case called at 9:37 a.m. ADA Nieskes files Amended Information which adds Count 3 - Disorderly. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. Atty. Schlitz files plea questionnaire. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. ADA Nieskes makes Oral Amendment to Amended Information and will file second Amended Information. Court reads charges and possible penalties for Counts 1 and 3, def pleads Guilty to both Counts. Court uses complaints and prelim hearing as factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudicates def guilty of count 3. Court withholds adjudication of Count 1 based upon compliance. Court dismisses Count 2. Attys make sentencing arguments.
Court Orders on Count 3: S/W 1 year Probation with conditions:
- Court costs $243, apply bond on file
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Sign up for Probation in Hudson, WI, but may be transferred to La Crosse County where def resides
-Def advised of right to appeal
Court reviews DJOC. Court confirms address. Court modifies bond for Count 1 to signature bond. Court approves DJOC agreement and signs Order. Adjourned 10:02 a.m.
